TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ColumnProvider extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for column providers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Column providers must extend this class. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> class and the ADO.NET Entity Framework class are providers that extend this class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.TableProvider table) cil managed

Docs.param: The table that contains the column.
Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected static System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection AddDefaultAttributes (System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider, System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection attributes);

.method familystatic hidebysig class System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection AddDefaultAttributes(class System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider, class System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection attributes) cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> collection, but the model provider requires this attribute, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.RequiredAttribute> object is added. If the `attributes` parameter does not contain the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> collection and the column that is represented by this provider is a string, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.StringLengthAttribute> object is added.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.AssociationProvider Association { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets the provider for the table that a column represents.
Docs.value: The provider for a table that a column represents, if one exists; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the attributes that are defined for the column that is represented by this provider.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Type ColumnType { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of the column.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Reflection.PropertyInfo EntityTypeProperty { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the property that represents the column in the entity type.
Docs.value: The value of the property that represents the column in the entity type.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsCustomProperty { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context.
Docs.value: if the column is an additional property that is not in the model's data context; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Columns that are not in the data context typically come from a view or calculated property. The value of the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property can be used to determine whether column operations such as sorting are supported. For example, the implementation of the <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable?displayProperty=fullName> interface of the data model will not support sorting on properties that return `true` for the <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider.IsCustomProperty%2A> property, because the column does not exist in the database.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsForeignKeyComponent { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is part of a foreign key.
Docs.value: if the column is part of a foreign key; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not set for strongly typed entity reference columns that are members of the table entity (a table object in the data model).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsGenerated { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column value is automatically generated by the database.
Docs.value: if the column value is automatically generated by the database; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsPrimaryKey { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is part of the primary key for the table.
Docs.value: if the column is part of the primary key for the table; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsReadOnly { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the column is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsSortable { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value that indicates whether the data model supports sorting the table by this column.
Docs.value: if the data model supports sorting the table by this column; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int MaxLength { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length that is allowed for this column.
Docs.value: The maximum length that is allowed for this column.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property applies to string data types only.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string Name { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Nullable { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column accepts null values.
Docs.value: if the column accepts null values; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property specifies whether the column accepts null values as defined by the data provider. For more information, see [Handling Null Values](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/handling-null-values.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the table that the column belongs to.
Docs.value: The table that the column belongs to.
